question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct about the term “Quasars”, sometimes seen in the news?
  1. Quasars live only in galaxies with supermassive black holes
  2. Quasars emit energy that can be observed at radio, infrared, visible, ultraviolet as well as x-ray wavelengths
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. Quasars live only in galaxies with supermassive black holes. These are distant objects that consist of a supermassive black hole surrounded by an orbiting gas. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. Quasars emit energy across the electromagnetic spectrum that can be observed at radio, infrared, visible, ultraviolet, and X-ray wavelengths. Quasars are thought to form in regions of the universe where the large-scale density of matter is much higher than average. Most quasars have been found billions of light-years away.
